intro: Rhacoma crossopetalum f. rotundata, commonly known as the rounded-leaved rhacoma, is a unique variant of the rhacoma genus. It is characterized by its distinctive rounded leaves, which differ from the typical leaf shape of the species. This plant is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia, where it thrives in humid, tropical environments. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a variety of flowering plants. The botanical interest in this form lies in its morphological variation and potential ecological adaptations.
